alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:53PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Chouteau and northern Cascade Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 352 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Belt to 12 miles southwest of Great Falls to near Cascade. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Belt, Black Eagle, Malmstrom Afb, Eden, Stockett, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Sun River, Ulm and Sand Coulee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cascade County below 5000ft; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains
